recocam 1.0.0.0
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Wrangling camera trap images with recocam

Takes a data frame of information extracted from image EXIF data and processes it into a format usable with the camtrapR package.

prep_camtrapr.Rd

To make this function work, you have to do a couple things. First, you need to manually tag your images. These tags must use a specific tagging scheme. Your tags should be numbered. More importantly, you need to have species records recorded like this: one tag for each species in the image (i.e. species_1, species_2), and one tag for the number of that species (i.e. no_of_species_1, no_of_species_2).

prep_camtrapr(df_fixed, number_of_species = 2)

Arguments

df_fixed

A data frame of data extracted from images using gather_images.
number_of_species

An integer specifying how many species could be tagged in a single image. This integer wil be used to help specifiy the number of columns that we want the function to work on.

Value

df_camtrapr, a data frame that can be used for all sorts of analysis with the camtrapR r package.

Contents

Developed by Vijay Raghunath, Henry Lydecker, Darya Vanichkina.
